member.name: M:EnergyAnalysisForDynamo.EnergySettings.GetEnergySettings
member.summary: Gets existing Energy Data Settings from current document

member.name: M:EnergyAnalysisForDynamo.EnergySettings.SetEnergySettings(System.String,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the Enegry Data Settings
member.param: Input Building Type
Input glazing percentage (range: 0 to 1)
Shading Depth, specified as a double. We assume the double value represents a length using Dynamo's current length unit.
Input skylight percentage (range: 0 to 1)
Input Building HVAC system
Input Building Operating Schedule

member.name: T:EnergyAnalysisForDynamo.PrepareEnergyModel
member.summary: Contains Dynamo nodes that deal with a Revit model's Analysis zones and surfaces

member.name: M:EnergyAnalysisForDynamo.PrepareEnergyModel.AnalysisSurfacePoint(EnergyAnalysisForDynamo.ElementId)
member.summary: Draws a point around the center of an analysis surface. Useful for sorting/grouping surfaces upstream of a SetSurfaceParameters node.
member.param: The ElementId of the surface to create a point from. Get this from the AnalysisZones > CreateFrom* > SurfaceIds output list

member.name: M:EnergyAnalysisForDynamo.PrepareEnergyModel.AnalysisSurfaceVector(EnergyAnalysisForDynamo.ElementId)
member.summary: Returns a vector represnting the normal of an analysis surface. Useful for sorting/grouping surfaces upstream of a SetSurfaceParameters node.
member.param: The ElementId of the surface to create a vector from. Get this from AnalysisZones > CreateFrom* > SurfaceIds output list

member.name: M:EnergyAnalysisForDynamo.PrepareEnergyModel.CreateEnergyModelFromMassAndLevels(Revit.Elements.AbstractFamilyInstance,System.Collections.Generic.List{Revit.Elements.Element})
member.summary: Creates mass floors and analysis zones from a [conceptual mass] family instance and a list of levels.
member.param: The conceptual mass family instance to create zones from
A list of levels to create mass floors with

member.name: M:EnergyAnalysisForDynamo.PrepareEnergyModel.CreateEnergyModelFromMass(Revit.Elements.AbstractFamilyInstance)
member.summary: Creates analysis zones from a [conceptual mass] family instance which already contains at least one mass floor.
member.param: The conceptual mass family instance to create zones from

member.name: M:EnergyAnalysisForDynamo.PrepareEnergyModel.DecomposeZone(EnergyAnalysisForDynamo.ElementId)
member.summary: Exposes an analysis zone's properties, including the zone's exterior face element ids.
member.param: The ElementId of the zone to inspect. Get this from the PrepareEnergyModel > CreateFrom* > ZoneIds output list

member.name: M:EnergyAnalysisForDynamo.PrepareEnergyModel.DrawAnalysisSurface(EnergyAnalysisForDynamo.ElementId)
member.summary: Draws a mesh in Dynamo representing an analysis surface. Useful when trying to identify a surface to modify.
member.param: The ElementId of the surface to draw. Get this from AnalysisZones > CreateFrom* > SurfaceIds output list

member.name: M:EnergyAnalysisForDynamo.PrepareEnergyModel.DrawAnalysisZone(EnergyAnalysisForDynamo.ElementId)
member.summary: Draws an analysis zone in Dynamo. Use this to identify which zone is which in the CreateFromMass/CreateFromMassAndLevels 'ZoneIds' output list.
member.param: The ElementId of the zone to draw. Get this from the AnalysisZones > CreateFrom* > ZoneIds output list
member.returns: A list of Dynamo meshes for each zone.

member.name: M:EnergyAnalysisForDynamo.PrepareEnergyModel.SetRoofSurfaceParameters(EnergyAnalysisForDynamo.ElementId,System.Double,System.String)
member.summary: Sets a roof surface's energy parameters
member.param: The ElementId of the surface to modify. Get this from the AnalysisZones > CreateFrom* > SurfaceIds output list
Conceptual Construction Type. Use the Conceptual Construction Types Dropdown node from our EnergySettings tab to specify a value.

member.name: M:EnergyAnalysisForDynamo.PrepareEnergyModel.SetWallSurfaceParameters(EnergyAnalysisForDynamo.ElementId,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.String)
member.summary: Sets an exterior wall surface's energy parameters
member.param: The ElementId of the surface to modify. Get this from the AnalysisZones > CreateFrom* > SurfaceIds output list
Percentage of glazed area. Should be a double between 0.0 - 1.0
Shading Depth, specified as a double. We assume the double value represents a length using Dynamo's current length unit.
Target sill height, specified as a double. We assume the double value represents a length using Dynamo's current length unit.
Conceptual Construction Type. Use the Conceptual Construction Types Dropdown node from our EnergySettings tab to specify a value.

member.name: M:EnergyAnalysisForDynamo.PrepareEnergyModel.SetZoneParameters(EnergyAnalysisForDynamo.ElementId,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Sets an analysis zone's energy parameters
member.param: The ElementId of the zone to modify. Get this from the AnalysisZones > CreateFrom* > ZoneIds output list
Sets the zone's space type. Use the Space Types Dropdown node from our EnergySetting tab to specify a value.
Sets the zone's condition type. Use the Condition Types Dropdown node from our EnergySetting tab to specify a value.

member.name: M:EnergyAnalysisForDynamo.PrepareEnergyModel.GetAverageFaceHeight(Autodesk.Revit.DB.Face)
member.summary: returns the average height of a face by averaging it's points' v values (for ruled faces - origin is returned fro planar faces.
member.param: the face
member.returns: average height of the face, or it's origin height

member.summary: Gets Energy, Carbon Cost Summary
member.remarks: Estimated Energy and Cost Summary Assumptions:
30-year life and 6.1 % discount rate for costs. Does not include electric transmission loses or renewable and natural ventilation potential.
